means: Free on Rail 铁路[火车上]交货（价格）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些连词均含有"因为"之意。
means: as ：从属连词，语意较because, since弱，着重在主句，所表示的原因或理由是"附带的"。
because ：从属连词，语意强，着重直接的原因或理由，所引出的从句是全句的重心，用以回答why提出的问题。
for ：并列连词，语气较弱，所引出的句子一般放在后面，表示附带说明的理由或推断理由。
since ：语意比because弱，但比as强，一般用于表示"由于大家已知的事实"。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个前置词都有"在……期"之意。
means: during ： 侧重指习惯性的某一段时间，而for指特定的某一段时间；during指继续的时间概念，突出事件发生的时刻，而for侧重事件持续时间的总长度。

sentence.Network_en: For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbours, and laugh at them in our turn?
sentence.Network_cn: 我们活着是为了什么？不就是给邻居当笑柄，再反过来笑他们。

sentence.Network_en: Sometimes things have to fall apart to make way for better things.
sentence.Network_cn: 有时候要到达谷底，才会慢慢变好。

sentence.Network_en: Do not wait for good things to happen to you. You need to walk towards happiness.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要等待好事降临，你要向幸福进发。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 8,我认为，对我来说主要的事实是，知识分子是具有能力“向（to）”公众以及“为（for）”公众来代表、具现、表明讯息、观点、态度、哲学或意见的个人。而且这个角色也有尖锐的一面，在扮演这个角.
因字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 因素〖 factor;element〗 因为〖 because;for;onaccountof〗 因循〖 follow;continueinthesameoldrut〗.
介词有哪些?越多越好~~_爱问知识人 ... into： 进入 for： 表示目的，为了..... from： 从...地点起.
早饭（午饭，晚饭，正餐）吃……for 表示作为，当作，对于。She has eggs and apples for breakfast.

list.abs: this paper introduces the basic principle of the filter , expounds the structure of the spiral bandpass filter and the design method for the spiral bandpass filter based on the communication frequency , and proves this design method through testing .介绍了滤波
江苏牛津英语高二英语 - 豆丁网 ... 延迟，阻碍，支撑 hold up 4. 打猎，搜捕 hunt for 9. 控制，支配 have power over 12.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... as for as 就…而论，据… as for 至于，就…方面说 as good as 几乎(实际)已经.
初中英语短语大全 ... 46．have meals 吃饭 47．look for 寻找 48．the first floor 第一层.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)be in imminent danger of punishment or other trouble
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英， 非正式)即将受惩罚，即将倒霉

phrase.cizu_name: do something for one's country (或England 等)

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)used to indicate that someone does or can do the specified activity with great enthusiasm or tirelessness
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)［用以表示某人极感兴趣或不知疲倦地做某事］乐此不疲地做某事

lj.lj_ls: 在津津有味地大吃吗，巴里？。

jx.jx_en_mean: (S. African informal)in huge numbers or quantities; galore
jx.jx_cn_mean: (南非，非正式)数量巨大；丰富的

lj.lj_ly: you're going to and I'll tell you for why.
lj.lj_ls: 你得做，我会告诉你为什么。

lj.lj_ly: oh for a strong black coffee!.
lj.lj_ls: 要是有杯浓浓的黑咖啡多好啊！。

jx.jx_en_mean: used ironically to indicate a particularly poor example of (a quality mentioned)

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, probably a reduction of a Germanic preposition meaning 'before' (in place or time); related to German für, also to fore

encyclopedia.content: 编程中用于循环处理的语句。Java的for语句形式有两种：一种是和C语言中的for语句形式一样，另一种形式用于在集合和数组之中进行迭代。有时候把这种形式称为增强的for(enhanced for)语句，它可以使循环更加紧凑和容易阅读。它的一般形式为： for(<；初始化>;<条件表达式>;<增量>) 语句； 初始化总是一个赋值语句，它用来给循环控制变量赋初值；条件表达式是一个关系表达式，它决定什么时候退出循环；增量定义循环控制变量每循环一次后按什么方式变化。这三个部分之间用";"分开。

entry.def: If something is for someone, they are intended to have it or benefit from it.

example.ex: Isn't that enough for you?...
example.tran: 那对你来说不够吗？

example.ex: I have some free advice for you.
example.tran: 我可以为你提供免费咨询。

entry.def: If you work or do a job for someone, you are employed by them.

example.ex: I knew he worked for a security firm...
example.tran: 我知道他在一家保安公司工作。

example.ex: Have you had any experience writing for radio?
example.tran: 你有给电台写稿子的经验吗？

entry.def: If you speak or act for a particular group or organization, you represent them.

example.ex: She appears nightly on the television news, speaking for the State Department.
example.tran: 她作为国务院的发言人，每晚都会出现在电视新闻中。

example.ex: ...the spokesman for the Democrats.
example.tran: 民主党发言人

entry.def: If someone does something for you, they do it so that you do not have to do it.

example.ex: If your pharmacy doesn't stock the product you want, have them order it for you...
example.tran: 如果药店没有你想要的药品，让他们为你订购。

example.ex: I hold a shop door open for an old person...
example.tran: 我帮一位老人把住店门。

entry.def: If you feel a particular emotion for someone, you feel it on their behalf.

example.ex: This is the best thing you've ever done – I am so happy for you!...
example.tran: 这是你做得最棒的一件事——我为你感到高兴！

example.ex: He felt a great sadness for this little girl.
example.tran: 他为这个小女孩深感悲哀。

entry.def: If you feel a particular emotion for someone or something, they are the object of that emotion, and you feel it when you think about them.

example.ex: John, I'm sorry for Steve, but I think you've made the right decisions...
example.tran: 约翰，我为史蒂夫感到难过，但是我想你的决定是正确的。

example.ex: Mack felt a pitiless contempt for her.
example.tran: 麦克对她没有同情，只有鄙夷。

entry.def: You use for after words such as 'time', 'space', 'money', or 'energy' when you say how much there is or whether there is enough of it in order to be able to do or use a particular thing.

example.ex: Many new trains have space for wheelchair users...
example.tran: 许多新型列车为坐轮椅者留有空间。

example.ex: It would take three to six hours for a round trip...
example.tran: 往返行程需要 3 到 6 个小时。

entry.def: If something is for sale, hire, or use, it is available to be sold, hired, or used.

example.ex: ...fishmongers displaying freshwater fish for sale...
example.tran: 摆摊卖淡水鱼的鱼贩

example.ex: Skis are available for hire on a daily basis.
example.tran: 雪橇可以按天租用。

entry.def: You use for when you state or explain the purpose of an object, action, or activity.

example.ex: ...drug users who use unsterile equipment for injections of drugs...
example.tran: 使用未经消毒的注射器注射毒品的吸毒者

example.ex: The knife for cutting sausage was sitting in the sink.
example.tran: 切香肠用的刀放在水槽里。

entry.def: You use for after nouns expressing reason or cause.

example.ex: He's soon to make a speech in parliament explaining his reasons for going...
example.tran: 他很快要在议会发表讲话，说明他辞职的原因。

example.ex: The county hospital could find no physical cause for Sumner's problems...
example.tran: 关于萨姆纳的问题，县医院查不出任何生理上的原因。

entry.def: You can use for to introduce a clause which gives the reason why you made the statement in the main clause.

example.ex: He had a great desire to have a home of his own for he had always lived with my grandmother.
example.tran: 他强烈渴望拥有一个属于自己的家，因为他一直和我祖母住在一起。

entry.def: You can use for to introduce the cause of the fact that you have just mentioned.

example.ex: ...doing jobs that others turn down for lack of skill...
example.tran: 做别人不愿意做的没有技术含量的工作

example.ex: They cannot sleep for hunger.
example.tran: 他们饿得睡不着。

entry.tran: (用于条件句中)如果不是为了，要不是
entry.def: For is used in conditional sentences, in expressions such as 'if not for' and 'were it not for', to introduce the only thing which prevents the main part of the sentence from being true.

example.ex: If not for John, Brian wouldn't have learned the truth...
example.tran: 要不是因为约翰，布赖恩也不可能知道真相。

example.ex: The earth would be a frozen ball if it were not for the radiant heat of the sun...
example.tran: 如果没有太阳辐射的热量，地球就会变成一个冰球。

entry.def: You use for to say how long something lasts or continues.

example.ex: The toaster remained on for more than an hour...
example.tran: 烤面包机持续开了一个多小时。

example.ex: For a few minutes she sat on her bed watching the clock...
example.tran: 她坐在床上盯着时钟看了几分钟。

entry.def: You use for to say how far something extends.

example.ex: We drove on for a few miles...
example.tran: 我们继续往前开了几公里。

example.ex: Great clouds of black smoke were rising for several hundred feet or so.
example.tran: 大片的黑色烟云升至大约几百英尺的空中。

entry.def: If something is bought, sold, or done for a particular amount of money, that amount of money is its price.

example.ex: We got the bus back to Tange for 30 cents...
example.tran: 我们花了 30 美分坐公共汽车回到坦格。

example.ex: The Martins sold their house for about 1.4 million pounds...
example.tran: 马丁夫妇把他们的房子卖了 140 万英镑。

entry.def: If something is planned for a particular time, it is planned to happen then.

example.ex: ...the Welsh Boat Show, planned for July 30–August 1...
example.tran: 预定于 7 月 30 日至 8 月 1 日期间举办的威尔士船展

example.ex: Marks & Spencer will be unveiling its latest fashions for autumn and winter...
example.tran: 玛莎百货的最新款秋冬季时装即将亮相。

entry.def: If you do something for a particular occasion, you do it on that occasion or to celebrate that occasion.

example.ex: He asked his daughter what she would like for her birthday...
example.tran: 他问女儿过生日想要什么。

example.ex: I'll be home for Christmas.
example.tran: 我会回家过圣诞节。

entry.def: If you leave for a particular place or if you take a bus, train, plane, or boat for a place, you are going there.

example.ex: They would be leaving for Rio early the next morning.
example.tran: 他们第二天一早要去里约。

entry.def: You use for when you make a statement about something in order to say how it affects or relates to someone, or what their attitude to it is.

example.ex: What matters for most scientists is money and facilities...
example.tran: 对多数科学家来说，资金和设备是至关重要的。

example.ex: For her, books were as necessary to life as bread...
example.tran: 对她来说，书就像面包一样，是生活必需品。

entry.tran: (用于形容词、名词和动词短语后，引出其后动词不定式的主语)
entry.def: After some adjective, noun, and verb phrases, you use for to introduce the subject of the action indicated by the following infinitive verb.

example.ex: It might be possible for a single woman to be accepted as a foster parent...
example.tran: 有可能会接受单身女子作为领养人。

example.ex: I had made arrangements for my affairs to be dealt with by one of my children...
example.tran: 我已经安排我的一个孩子处理我的事务。

entry.tran: 就…而言(表示相对来说不寻常)
entry.def: You use for when you say that an aspect of something or someone is surprising in relation to other aspects of them.

example.ex: He was tall for an eight-year-old...
example.tran: 对一个 8 岁的孩子而言，他长得很高。

example.ex: He had too much money for a young man.
example.tran: 对于一个年轻人来说，他太有钱了。

entry.def: If you say that you are for a particular activity, you mean that this is what you want or intend to do.

example.ex: Right, who's for a toasted sandwich then?...
example.tran: 好吧，谁想要吐司三明治？

example.ex: 'What'll it be?' Paul said. —'I'm for halibut.'
example.tran: “要吃什么？”保罗说。——“我要吃大比目鱼。”

entry.def: If you say that something is not for you, you mean that you do not enjoy it or that it is not suitable for you.

example.ex: Wendy decided the sport was not for her...
example.tran: 温迪认定这项运动不适合她。

example.ex: Not for me the settled life...
example.tran: 安定的生活并不适合我。

entry.tran: (表示负有责任或享有权利)由…
entry.def: If it is for you to do something, it is your responsibility or right to do it.

example.ex: I wish you would come back to Washington with us, but that's for you to decide...
example.tran: 我希望你能和我们一起回华盛顿，但是这由你决定。

example.ex: It is not for me to arrange such matters.
example.tran: 我无权安排这些事情。

entry.def: If you are for something, you agree with it or support it.

example.ex: Are you for or against public transport?...
example.tran: 你是支持还是反对公共交通？

example.ex: I'm for a government that the people respect and that respects the people...
example.tran: 我拥护一个受到人民尊重并且尊重人民的政府。

entry.tran: (用于 argue, case, evidence, vote 等词后，引出所支持或被证明之事)
entry.def: You use for after words such as 'argue', 'case', 'evidence', or 'vote' in order to introduce the thing that is being supported or proved.

example.ex: Another union has voted for industrial action in support of a pay claim...
example.tran: 另一个工会已经投票赞成采取要求加薪的劳工行动。

example.ex: The case for nuclear power is impressive...
example.tran: 这个支持核能的案例令人印象深刻。

entry.tran: (置于某些名词、形容词或动词后，引出更多信息或与某性质、事物或行为相关的事物)
entry.def: For is the preposition that is used after some nouns, adjectives, or verbs in order to introduce more information or to indicate what a quality, thing, or action relates to.

example.ex: Reduced-calorie cheese is a great substitute for cream cheese...
example.tran: 低卡路里干酪是奶油干酪的极佳替代品。

example.ex: Car park owners should be legally responsible for protecting vehicles...
example.tran: 停车场场主有保护停放车辆的法律责任。

entry.def: To be named for someone means to be given the same name as them.

example.ex: The Brady Bill is named for former White House Press Secretary James Brady...
example.tran: 布雷迪法案是以前白宫新闻秘书詹姆斯·布雷迪的名字命名的。

example.ex: Ayer started N. W. Ayer & Son in 1869, naming the firm for his father.
example.tran: 艾尔在1869 年成立了 N. W. 艾尔父子公司，公司以他父亲的名字命名。

entry.tran: (与 every 连用，引出比率)每…(就有…)
entry.def: You use for with 'every' when you are stating a ratio, to introduce one of the things in the ratio.

example.ex: For every farm job that is lost, two or three other jobs in the area are put at risk...
example.tran: 在该地区每有一个农民失去工作，另外两到三个从事其他工作的人就会面临失业的危险。

example.ex: Where there had been one divorce for every 100 marriages before the war, now there were five.
example.tran: 战前每100对夫妇中有一对离婚，现在则是 5 对。

entry.tran: (用于比较)每镑对每镑/每英里对每英里
entry.def: You can use for in expressions such as pound for pound or mile for mile when you are making comparisons between the values or qualities of different things.

example.ex: ...the Antarctic, mile for mile one of the planet's most lifeless areas...
example.tran: 南极洲的每一寸土地和世界上其他地方相比都是最荒芜的

example.ex: He insists any tax cut be matched dollar-for-dollar with cuts in spending.
example.tran: 他坚持每一项减税都要和支出削减一一对应。

entry.def: If a word or expression has the same meaning as another word or expression, you can say that the first one is another word or expression for the second one.

example.ex: The technical term for sunburn is erythema...
example.tran: 晒斑的专业术语是红斑。

example.ex: Cancer is derived from the Greek word for crab, karkinos.
example.tran: cancer 这个词派生自希腊语中表示螃蟹的 karkinos 一词

entry.tran: (引出可在其他地方找到的信息)至于，对于
entry.def: You use for in a piece of writing when you mention information which will be found somewhere else.

example.ex: For further information on the life of William James Sidis, see Amy Wallace, 'The Prodigy'.
example.tran: 想了解关于威廉·詹姆斯·西迪斯生平的更多信息，请参阅埃米·华莱士所著《神童》。

entry.tran: (尽管有不同意见或实际困难)完全赞成,坚信
entry.def: If you say that you are all for doing something, you agree or strongly believe that it should be done, but you are also often suggesting that other people disagree with you or that there are practical difficulties.

example.ex: I am all for cutting carbon dioxide emissions, but that would be much more easily achieved by giving subsidies to windpower, than with nuclear power...
example.tran: 我完全赞成减少二氧化碳的排放，但是，相比发展核能，对发展风能提供补贴更容易实现这一目标。

example.ex: He is all for players earning what they can while they are in the game...
example.tran: 他完全赞成现役运动员尽可能多赚钱。

entry.def: If you are in for it or, in British English, if you are for it, you are likely to get into trouble because of something you have done.
You use expressions such as for the first time and for the last time when you are talking about how often something has happened before.

example.ex: He was married for the second time, this time to a Belgian...
example.tran: 他第二次结婚，这一次是和一个比利时人。

example.ex: For the first time in my career, I was failing.
example.tran: 我职业生涯中第一次经历失败。

list.explanation: 不中用的，完蛋的，没有希望的

example.en: I knew I was done for.
example.zh: 我早就知道我没希望了。

example.en: His business is done for.
example.zh: 他的生意完蛋了。

example.en: This is certainly more than I bargained for.
example.zh: 这肯定是比我所指望能获得的还要多。

example.en: I haven't seen you for yonks.
example.zh: 我好久没见你了。

example.en: We had a beautiful room at the hotel and the service was to die for.
example.zh: 我们住在那家旅馆里，不仅房间很漂亮，而且服务很周到。

list.explanation: (对某人)产生强烈的爱或情欲

example.en: I'd never have the deep undying hots for that rah-rah boy.
example.zh: 对那个大学生，我永远也不会有深邃永恒的爱。

list.explanation: (表示强调、惊讶、不耐烦、怀疑、沮丧等的感叹语)

example.en: I already did it,for the love of Pete!
example.zh: 嘿，瞧我已经干完了!

list.explanation: 为…辩护，支持、维护(某人或某事)

example.en: If his own family won't,who will stick up for him?
example.zh: 要是他自己家里的人都不管,那么谁会愿意站出来为他说话？

example.en: Stick up for your rights!
example.zh: 站起来维护你自己的权利!

example.en: Hatfmld had it in for McCoy.
example.zh: 哈特菲尔德对麦科伊十分不满。

list.explanation: 把某人或某物击倒，痛击某人

example.en: We knocked the villain for a loop.
example.zh: 我们把那恶棍狠狠揍了一顿。

list.explanation: 使某人十分惊奇、诧异、剌激、非常快活

example.en: The news of their marriage threw me for a loop.
example.zh: 他俩结婚的消息让我十分诧异。

example.en: I don't believe this climactic sequence doesn't knock you for a loop.
example.zh: 我不相信这一连串的高潮都剌激不了你。

example.en: Wouldn't that knock the boys for a loop?
example.zh: 难道那还不能让那些孩子快活吗？

list.explanation: 使某人或某事陷入困境，使受到严重干扰

example.en: The whole economy was thrown for a loop.
example.zh: 整个经济陷入了困境。

example.en: It must have knocked him for a loop,but he asked.
example.zh: 这件事一定使他吃了大亏，但这是他自找的。

example.en: He said he wouldn't stand for being replaced.
example.zh: 他说他不能听任被人撤换。

list.explanation: (尤指在赛马中)作出极大努力，跑得很快

example.en: I suppose the chestnut horse will go for the doctor and get a huge win at this races.
example.zh: 我想那匹叫栗色马 一定会跑得很快,在 这次赛马会上准会大获成功。

example.en: I'll go for tlie doctor thai he's there.
example.zh: 我敢打赌，他准在那儿。

list.explanation: 自找麻烦，自讨苦吃，惹人恼火

example.en: I don't know how they live down there. It's asking for it.
example.zh: 我不知道他们在那边怎么过日子。那是自讨苦吃。

auth_sentence.content: Let's wait for next week's Republican convention.
auth_sentence.res_content: Let's wait for next week's Republican convention.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let's wait for next week's Republican convention.

auth_sentence.content: Let's hope for a fantastic week of tennis!
auth_sentence.res_content: Let's hope for a fantastic week of tennis!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let's hope for a fantastic week of tennis!

auth_sentence.content: It is a recurring theme for them this season.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is a recurring theme for them this season.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is a recurring theme for them this season.

Sentence.sentence: The shortcomings of traditional print edition textbooks are obvious: For starters they're heavy, with the average physics textbook weighing 3.06 pounds.
For sociable souls, meeting new people by staying in their homes is part of the charm.
Question 14: For what were Dennis Hutton and his wife awarded the Nobel Prize a second time?

means.word_mean: (表示方向)向, 朝, 开往

sentences.en: They made a rush for the exit.

means.word_mean: (表示对象) 替, 帮, 给, 为…做准备, 对, 对于, 对…来说, 在…一方

sentences.en: What can I do for you?
Let me lift that heavy box for you.
sentences.cn: 让我替你提那只重箱子。

sentences.en: You had to be ready for any emergency.
This inspired in them a love for learning.
sentences.cn: 这使他们产生了学习的热情。

sentences.en: Fortunately for him, he can swim.
sentences.cn: 对他来说幸运的是, 他会游泳。

sentences.en: He speaks too softly for her to hear.
sentences.cn: 他讲话声音太轻, 她听不见。

means.word_mean: (表示原因)因为, 由于, 作为…的结果

sentences.en: I'm pretty angry with you for not telling me.
sentences.cn: 由于你没有告诉我, 我对你很生气。

sentences.en: I followed him for some distance.
sentences.cn: 我跟着他走了一段路程。

means.word_mean: (表示结果)当做, 作为, 作为…的部分, 就…的条件而言

sentences.en: We can't accept that as a basis for a decision.
sentences.cn: 我们不能同意以此为基础来做出决定。

sentences.en: The ship sent out a message for help.
She's the very person for the work.

means.word_mean: (表示态度)支持, 赞同, 想要

sentences.en: Are you for the plan or against it?
sentences.cn: 你支持这计划还是反对它呢?

means.word_mean: (表示比率)按…比例, 以…价格, 第…次

sentences.cn: 我买这本书花了三英镑。

sentences.en: I met them for the second time last week.
sentences.cn: 我上周第二次遇见他们。

sentences.en: Prepare to alight, for we are almost there.
sentences.cn: 我们马上要到了, 准备下车吧。

jushi.english: Fortunately for him, he can swim.
jushi.chinese: 对他来说幸运的是,他会游泳。

jushi.english: He speaks too softly for her to hear.
jushi.chinese: 他讲话声音太轻,她听不见。
